q: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
h:
“Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.
h:
“Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.
h:
“Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
h:
“If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Decide whether or not the goal is worth the risks involved. If it is, stop worrying.
h:
“Decide whether or not the goal is worth the risks involved. If it is, stop worrying.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.
h:
“Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Each day provides it's own gifts.
h:
“Each day provides it's own gifts.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.
h:
“Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.” —
Richard Bach

q: Rather than waste time and energy worrying, use that time and energy to constructively deal with whatever is causing the worry.
h:
“Rather than waste time and energy worrying, use that time and energy to constructively deal with whatever is causing the worry.” —
Celestine Chua

q: The seasons do not push one another; neither do clouds race the wind across the sky. All things happen in their own good time.
h:
“The seasons do not push one another; neither do clouds race the wind across the sky. All things happen in their own good time.” —
Dan Millman

q: Do something worth remembering.
h:
“Do something worth remembering.” —
Elvis Presley

q: Success is the child of drudgery and perseverance. It cannot be coaxed or bribed; pay the price and it is yours.
h:
“Success is the child of drudgery and perseverance. It cannot be coaxed or bribed; pay the price and it is yours. ” —
Orison Swett Marden

q: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
h:
“Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.
h:
“To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Wrong turns are as important as right turns. More important, sometimes.
h:
“Wrong turns are as important as right turns. More important, sometimes.” —
Richard Bach

q: Pleasure is always derived from something outside you, whereas joy arises from within.
h:
“Pleasure is always derived from something outside you, whereas joy arises from within. ” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Still your waters.
h:
“Still your waters.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Even if you're sure you can win, be careful that you can live with what you lose.
h:
“Even if you're sure you can win, be careful that you can live with what you lose.” —
Gary Keller

q: Trust is built and maintained by many small actions over time.
h:
“Trust is built and maintained by many small actions over time.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Find the game where you can win, and then commit your life to playing it; and play to win.
h:
“Find the game where you can win, and then commit your life to playing it; and play to win.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: We must have strong minds, ready to accept facts as they are.
h:
“We must have strong minds, ready to accept facts as they are.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: A liar knows that he is a liar, but one who speaks mere portions of truth in order to deceive is a craftsman of destruction.
h:
“A liar knows that he is a liar, but one who speaks mere portions of truth in order to deceive is a craftsman of destruction.” —
Criss Jami

q: Always try to be a little kinder than necessary.
h:
“Always try to be a little kinder than necessary.” —
James Matthew Barrie

q: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
h:
“The most effective way to do it, is to do it.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Learn only how to avoid seeking for and attaching yourselves to anything.
h:
“Learn only how to avoid seeking for and attaching yourselves to anything.” —
Huang Po

q: Don´t hesitate or allow yourself to make excuses. Just get out and do it.
h:
“Don´t hesitate or allow yourself to make excuses. Just get out and do it.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: A man sees in the world what he carries in his heart.
h:
“A man sees in the world what he carries in his heart.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: At every moment where language can't go, that's your mind.
h:
“At every moment where language can't go, that's your mind.” —
Bodhidharma

q: Anger begins with folly, and ends with repentance.
h:
“Anger begins with folly, and ends with repentance. ” —
Beverly Sills

q: There is no absolute success in the world, only constant progress.
h:
“There is no absolute success in the world, only constant progress.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night.
h:
“One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: What have you done today to make someone else happy?
h:
“What have you done today to make someone else happy?” —
Deepam Chaterjee

q: The world is open for play, everything and everybody is mockable in a wonderful way.
h:
“The world is open for play, everything and everybody is mockable in a wonderful way.” —
Robin Williams

q: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
h:
“He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.” —
Epictetus

q: You are the average of the five people you spend most time with.
h:
“You are the average of the five people you spend most time with.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Be like a postage stamp. Stick to it until you get there.
h:
“Be like a postage stamp. Stick to it until you get there.” —
Bob Proctor

q: No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.
h:
“No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.” —
James Allen

q: It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.
h:
“It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: Conquer the devils with a little thing called love.
h:
“Conquer the devils with a little thing called love.” —
Bob Marley

q: Respect is earned by effort not age, all things age without effort.
h:
“Respect is earned by effort not age, all things age without effort.” —
C. Sean McGee

q: It's not what you say out of your mouth that determines your life, it's what you whisper to yourself that has the most power!
h:
“It's not what you say out of your mouth that determines your life, it's what you whisper to yourself that has the most power!” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: The less people know, the more stubbornly they know it.
h:
“The less people know, the more stubbornly they know it.” —
Osho

q: No snowflake ever falls in the wrong place.
h:
“No snowflake ever falls in the wrong place.” —
Zen Proverb

q: No man is happy unless he believes he is.
h:
“No man is happy unless he believes he is.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.
h:
“Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as if nothing is a miracle. The other is as if everything is a miracle.
h:
“There are only two ways to live your life. One is as if nothing is a miracle. The other is as if everything is a miracle.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Discipline yourself, and others won't need to.
h:
“Discipline yourself, and others won't need to.” —
John Wooden

q: Thinking is the hardest work there is. That is why so few people engage in it.
h:
“Thinking is the hardest work there is. That is why so few people engage in it.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration.
h:
“If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration. ” —
Nikola Tesla

q: True love stories never have endings.
h:
“True love stories never have endings.” —
Richard Bach
